channel.title: One Square Meter
channel.description: A year-long biodiversity documetation of 1m² area in Gundmi, India.

item.title: Sighting: Dotted Sable Moth
item.description:
Dotted Sable Moth (Bocchoris inspersalis)

Category: Insect | Season: Winter

Very pleasing to see this on the patch. What a beauty!

Weather: 28.0°C, Partly cloudy

item.title: Sighting: Shore Fly
item.description:
Shore Fly (Psilopa sp)

Category: Insect | Season: Winter

I think I should simply stop trying take pics of these tiny flies until the macro flash arrives. Just impossible to get a good pic without extra light.

Weather: 28.0°C, Partly cloudy

item.title: Sighting: Fruit Fly
item.description:
Fruit Fly (Gastrozonini sp.)

Category: Insect | Season: Winter

Oooooh. I think they be making babies.

Weather: 28.0°C, Partly cloudy

item.title: Sighting: Ant-mimic Spider
item.description:
Ant-mimic Spider (Myrmarachne sp.)

Category: Insect | Season: Winter

Man. This fella gave me ample time to take good shots. Yet. Here we are.

Weather: 28.5°C, Partly cloudy

item.title: Sighting: White Rice Leafhopper
item.description:
White Rice Leafhopper (Cofana spectra)

Category: Insect | Season: Winter

Woah. Tiny. I think I was this close to a complete blank mind when I noticed this. This is true meditation.

Weather: 27.7°C, Partly cloudy

item.title: Sighting: Dirt Colored Seed Bug
item.description:
Dirt Colored Seed Bug (Pseudopachybrachius guttus)

Category: Insect | Season: Winter

Nice one, I like the patterns on it.

Weather: 27.7°C, Partly cloudy

item.title: Sighting: Dance Fly
item.description:
Dance Fly (Asyndetus sp.)

Category: Insect | Season: Winter

Dance fly, dance!

Weather: 27.7°C, Partly cloudy

item.title: Sighting: Bot Fly
item.description:
Bot Fly (Chetogena sp.)

Category: Insect | Season: Winter

Bot fly. What eles can I say?

Weather: 27.7°C, Partly cloudy

item.title: Sighting: Leaf Beetle
item.description:
Leaf Beetle (Altica cyanea)

Category: Insect | Season: Winter

Blue-ish black and very shiny. I had to use all my photography tricks in the bag to get these pics. I need to learn more tricks.

Weather: 27.7°C, Partly cloudy

item.title: Sighting: Sugar Ant
item.description:
Sugar Ant (Camponotus carin)

Category: Insect | Season: Winter

Late night bug hunting. No fun.

Weather: 27.7°C, Partly cloudy

item.title: Sighting: Bicolor-ant-mimicking Jumping Spider
item.description:
Bicolor-ant-mimicking Jumping Spider (Myrmarachne melanocephala)

Category: Arachnid | Season: Winter

Very funky spider. This one is mimicing Tetraponera rufonigra, a very similar colored ant with a very painful bite. I actually fell for it. Only after the first few pictures, did I notice the spider features.

Weather: 27.1°C, Overcast

item.title: Sighting: White-backed Planthopper
item.description:
White-backed Planthopper (Sogatella furcifera)

Category: Insect | Season: Winter

Argh. Not enough light even at 4 PM. Grainy images, and horrible photography skills.

Weather: 27.1°C, Overcast

item.title: Sighting: Black Ant Mimicking Jumper
item.description:
Black Ant Mimicking Jumper (Toxeus magnus)

Category: Arachnid | Season: Winter

This one took a lot of effort to take any decent picture. It kept moving in and around the undergrowth, never surfaced onto clear area.

Weather: 27.2°C, Partly cloudy

item.title: Sighting: Mayfly
item.description:
Mayfly (Ephemeroptera sp.)

Category: Insect | Season: Winter

Shot early-ish morning, not enough light to capture the details of this tiny fellow.

Weather: 27.2°C, Partly cloudy

item.title: Sighting: Leopard Spider
item.description:
Leopard Spider (Pardosa laura)

Category: Arachnid | Season: Winter

I am not sure of the species though. It is a wolf spider family, but can't be sure of the exact species.

Weather: 27.1°C, Overcast

item.title: Sighting: Seed Bug
item.description:
Seed Bug (Dieuches armatipes)

Category: Insect | Season: Winter

This one is new for me. I have seen similar on with red and black color during the day.

Weather: 27.1°C, Overcast

item.title: Sighting: Common Paddy Field Frog
item.description:
Common Paddy Field Frog (Minervarya agricola)

Category: Amphibian | Season: Winter

Woohoo! First frog on the patch!! I love frogs.

Weather: 27.1°C, Overcast

item.title: Sighting: Lynx Spider
item.description:
Lynx Spider (Oxyopes salticus)

Category: Arachnid | Season: Winter

Night photography. I have a long way to go to learn this art.

Weather: 27.1°C, Overcast

item.title: Sighting: Bornean Queenless Ant
item.description:
Bornean Queenless Ant (Diacamma rugosum)

Category: Insect | Season: Winter

I had the camera in wrong set up / mode and didn't notice until the bug moved away. Rookie mistake.

Weather: 27.1°C, Overcast

item.title: Sighting: Transverse Ladybird
item.description:
Transverse Ladybird (Coccinella transversalis)

Category: Insect | Season: Winter

I really like this shot. A spot of red amongst the sea of green.

Weather: 27.1°C, Overcast

item.title: Week 3: Settling in
item.description:
Oh it's a bug's life for me

Hello!

The flies from Tephritidae family have a funky dating process. Check it out here. I had to push myself a bit to record all of the footage over 3.5 hours. It was quite fascinating to see the whole thing happening.

Otherwise, the patch is still green, and quite a few varieties of bugs are still around. I think I have seen five or six different species that I haven't been able to get a decent picture of yet. So, fingers crossed!

’Til next week!

item.title: Week 2: Ants marching
item.description:
I have started talking to bugs.

Hello!

Did you know that ants do not trigger the touch-me-not plant’s defense mechanism? So cool!

Well, would you look at that stats page, so many numbers! I think I have documented quite a lot of “resident” bugs, and now the number of new species I encounter might start to decrease.

If you are planning to start a similar project, make sure you do not pick a plot right below a coconut tree. The plot I selected, however, is right beneath one. The tree’s branches look like they are ready to fall at any moment. So, this bug documentation project has turned into an adventure sport!

Note to self: Be graceful in your movements. Do not spook the bugs.

’Til next week!

item.title: Week 1: Not bad!
item.description:
My knees hurt.

Hello!

So, end of the week (well, just 4 days)! 20 species found, from very tiny to slightly bigger ones!

I saw 3 new hoppers that I hadn't seen before. They are tiny!

So, the morning light is not enough to get good quality photos, I have to bump up ISO, which leads to very grainy images. Looks like I will spend monies on a flash. Sigh.

My macro photography skills have rusted. I am hoping it will get better as the time goes on.

I also discoverd a very similar project done before by Chris Helzer. Read about it here. The photographs he has taken are very clean and precise! Now I have a benchmark to aim for!

One week at a time!

item.title: Day one!
item.description:
So it begins.

Hello world!

Welcome to a square meter project, here we like bugs. Find more about the project in the about section.

Today, I set up the fence posts on 4 corners of the patch, cleaned up the space a bit, placed an old wood piece in it. That is it. No more fiddling with the patch for the rest of the year.

My first immediate dilemma is this:

If I spot a bug within the square meter but it moves out of the boundary before I can get a photo, should I still take the picture and count it as a sighting, or should I let it go?
